page.title: 05Youth Organisations.
page.content: Many children between the ages of six and eighteen enjoy attending groups or{clubs}in the nineteen_eighties.These include established organisations like the Boys'Brigade and the Scouting Movement as well as local youth groups. Being a member of the Boys'Brigade or the Scouts involves attending weekly meetings where one can work for awards and badges.These include sporting activities,hobbies and interests as well as first aid,fire prevention and other safety measures. The atmosphere is pleasant and friendly and enjoyed by everyone. In the area studied there were Scout Troops,Cub Packs,Girl Guides,Brownies and Boys'Brigade units;as well as local Church and Youth groups.These may become a thing of the past as more and more people prefer to watch T.V.
